snippet: More than half of the record spending on negative advertising during the 2016 presidential primary has been directed at a single candidate, Mr. Trump.
abstract: Nearly $70 million of $132 million spent on negative ads in presidential campaign have been directed against Donald J Trump, onslaught that may already be undermining his popularity among voters; Trump has been targeted by three super PACs in addition to his Republican rivals, and even Hillary Clinton has moved to target him across primary lines.

byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI and MAGGIE HABERMAN

lead_paragraph: More than half of the record spending on negative advertising during the 2016 presidential primary has been directed at a single candidate, Mr. Trump.

headline.main: Barrage of Attack Ads Threatens to Undermine Donald Trump
headline.print_headline: Barrage of Ads May Undermine Trump Campaign
